sections.title: Scenario introduction — backend products project and DB initializer
sections.summary: Presenter describes a real scenario in a backend 'products' project using Entity Framework and questions whether the current DB initialization approach is correct.
key_actions: Open products project and inspect list of products and DbContext
Identify DB initializer pattern and question its suitability for EF Core 9
ui_elements: code editor (files: Products, DbContext, DB initializer class)

sections.title: Enable GitHub Copilot agent and Microsoft Docs tool
sections.summary: Enable GitHub Copilot agent mode and grant the agent access to Microsoft Docs as a tool; prepare a prompt asking whether the current DB initializer implementation is correct and request search of Microsoft Docs.
key_actions: Enable Microsoft Docs tool for the agent
Compose prompt asking if current DB initializer is the right way for EF Core 9
Request agent to base answer on full Microsoft Docs content

sections.title: Tool permission prompt and granting access
sections.summary: The system requests permission before a tool can run (for safety). Presenter chooses to allow the tool for this session to observe behavior.
key_actions: Respond to permission request for agent/tool
Choose permission scope: 'Always allow' or 'Allow only this time'

sections.title: Agent runs, searches docs and returns recommendations
sections.summary: Agent processes the request (takes a couple of minutes) and returns that the current DB initializer works but EF Core 9 has a recommended different approach; provides links and references.
key_actions: Wait for agent to perform search and analysis
Review agent's recommendation and links to documentation
Note suggested alternative implementations (two or more options)

sections.title: Trigger a new agent session and select model
sections.summary: Presenter starts a new agent session to ask the agent to implement the recommended changes. Note: each agent session is tied to a specific model; options include GPT-4.1 and GPT-5 (mentioned).
key_actions: Start new agent session for code changes
Select which model to use for the session (e.g., GPT-4.1, GPT-5)
Allow the agent to read related project files (Program, DbContext, etc.)
ui_elements: file browsing / code access by agent

sections.title: Agent implements code changes and final recommendations
sections.summary: Agent modifies classes to align with EF Core 9 recommended database initialization approach, suggests using MigrateAsync instead of EnsureCreatedAsync when using migrations, and provides code adjustments and documentation-backed implementation.
key_actions: Agent edits code to implement new DB initialization approach
Replace EnsureCreatedAsync with MigrateAsync when working with migrations
Review code changes across Program, DbContext, initializer classes
Optionally manually refine or accept agent changes
ui_elements: links to documentation and reference material

main_topics: Using GitHub Copilot Agent with external tools (Microsoft Docs)
Entity Framework Core 9 recommended database initialization patterns
Tool permission model and safety prompts
Agent sessions tied to specific models and model selection
Automated code modification and migration guidance (MigrateAsync vs EnsureCreatedAsync)
